intro: Pedicularis cernua subsp. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved lousewort, is a herbaceous perennial native to alpine and subalpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its drooping, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple, and its broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or open habitats. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. Due to its striking appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
